endUserId.description: Anything that uniquely identifies the end user that you will be sending the magic link to

validityInSeconds.description: How long the magic link will be valid for (in seconds) before it expires

endUserId.description: Anything that uniquely identifies the end user that you will be sending the magic link to

validityInSeconds.description: How long the magic link will be valid for (in seconds) before it expires

redirectUrl.description: Where to send user to after connect / if they press back button

connectorName.description: Filter connector config by connector name

post.description: Return records that would have otherwise been emitted during a sync and return it instead

metadata.description:
JSON object can can be used to associate arbitrary metadata to
  avoid needing a separate 1-1 table just for simple key values in your application.
  During updates this object will be shallowly merged

JSON object can can be used to associate arbitrary metadata to
  avoid needing a separate 1-1 table just for simple key values in your application.
  During updates this object will be shallowly merged

async.description: Run sync in the background, not compatible with other options for now...

metaOnly.description: Only sync resource metadata and skip pipelines

fullResync.description: Remove `state` of pipeline and trigger a full resync

todo_upstreamRefresh.description:
Triggers provider to refresh data from its source
    https://plaid.com/docs/api/products/transactions/#transactionsrefresh
    This may also load historical transactions. For example,
    Finicity treats historical transaction as premium service.

todo_removeUnsyncedData.description:
See coda's implmementation. Requires adding a new message to the sync protocol
    to remove all data from a particular source_id

links.description: Array of transformations that the data gets piped through on the way out. Typically used for things like unification / normalization.

defaultPipeOut.description: Automatically sync data from any resources associated with this config to the destination resource, which is typically a Postgres database. Think ETL

links.description: Array of transformations that the data gets piped through on the way out. Typically used for things like unification / normalization.

defaultPipeIn.description: Automatically sync data from any resources associated with this config to the destination resource, which is typically a Postgres database. Think ETL

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: When disabled it will not be used for connection portal. Essentially a reversible soft-delete

get.summary: Get current viewer accessing the API
Get current organization of viewer accessing the API

database_url.title: PostgreSQL Database URL
database_url.description: This is where data from resources are synced to by default

synced_data_schema.title: Synced Data Schema
synced_data_schema.description: Postgres schema to pipe data synced from end user resources into. Defaults to "synced" if missing.

webhook_url.title: Webhook URL
webhook_url.description: Events like sync.completed and connection.created can be sent to url of your choosing

migrate_tables.title: Migrate Tables
migrate_tables.description: If enabled, table migrations will be run if needed when entities are persisted

name.description: The name of the account to upsert on. Supported for Outreach, Salesloft, and Apollo.

domain.description: The domain of the account to upsert on. Only supported for Outreach and Salesloft.

email.description: Contact email to upsert on. Supported for Outreach, Salesloft, and Apollo.

key.description: The key to upsert on. Only `website` is supported for Salesforce, while both `domain` and `website` are supported for Hubspot.

values.description: The values to upsert on. If more than one value is provided, it will act as a logical OR. If more than one account is found that matches, then an error will be thrown.

key.description: The key to upsert on. Only `email` is supported for all providers.

values.description: The values to upsert on. If more than one value is provided, it will act as a logical OR. If more than one record is found that matches, then an error will be thrown.

id.description: The machine name of the property as it appears in the third-party Provider

label.description: The human-readable name of the property as provided by the third-party Provider.

type.description: The type of the property as provided by the third-party Provider. These types are not unified by OpenInt. For Intercom, this is string, integer, boolean, or object. For Outreach, this is integer, boolean, number, array, or string.

raw_details.description: The raw details of the property as provided by the third-party Provider, if available.

suggested_key_name.description: The underlying provider may change this (e.g. adding `__c` for Salesforce).

issues.description: An array of issues that were responsible for the error
An array of issues that were responsible for the error

account_id.description: The ID of the company to associate the note to.

id.description: The machine name of the property as it appears in the third-party Provider. In Salesforce, this must end with `__c`.

label.description: The human-readable name of the property as provided by the third-party Provider.

is_required.description: Whether or not this field is required. Must be false for Salesforce boolean fields.

default_value.description: The default value for the property. Only supported for Salesforce.

group_name.description: Only applicable for Hubspot. If specified, OpenInt will attempt to attach the field to this group if it exists, or create it if it doesn't.

precision.description: Only applicable in Salesforce. If not given, will default to 18.

scale.description: Only applicable in Salesforce. If not given, will default to 0.

options.description: The list of options for a picklist/multipicklist field.

raw_details.description: The raw details of the property as provided by the third-party Provider, if available.

crm.meta.property_type.description:
:::note
`picklist` and `multipicklist` property types are currently only supported in Salesforce and Hubspot
:::

:::note
`url` property type currently is only natively supported in Salesforce.
:::

id.description: The machine name of the property as it appears in the third-party Provider

label.description: The human-readable name of the property as provided by the third-party Provider.

type.description: The type of the property as provided by the third-party Provider. These types are not unified by OpenInt. For Intercom, this is string, integer, boolean, or object. For Outreach, this is integer, boolean, number, array, or string.

raw_details.description: The raw details of the property as provided by the third-party Provider, if available.
